review_title: Great for new Nurses and older seasoned nurses
pros: Good job for new Nurses to cultivate clinical skills
cons: Low wages, no union, and 5 years needed before vesting.

job_title: Caregiver, CNA in San Pedro, CA
pros: This institution was a non profit institution run by nuns that devoted their lives to helping the less fortunate. It was an honor working for them
cons: None at all very good place to fork at

pros: Good work environment and management
cons: Not enough pay, short staff

pros: Excellent culture Flexible working Excellent support Professional training
cons: Challenging work sector Pay in this sector needs improvement

pros: great and friendly environment it is
cons: THERE IS NONE SO FAR

pros: Great and friendly working environment
cons: There is none so far

review_title: Good and not good place to work
pros: Staff are all very nice and teamwork is a strong suit here. Has a family feel among staff. Can be nice make connections with residents sometimes.
cons: The pay is not that great. We're always short-staffed and so lots of us have to pick up extra shifts. People are hired but quickly quit when they realize the work load to pay ratio. Lots of work for little money. Sisters make racist remarks on occasion and push their religious beliefs on staff. Sisters are very judgemental and rude at times. They are not easy to work for. Insurance is not great. We are often so short staffed people can not take their vacations as there is not enough people to cover shifts.

review_title: Sincere care and respect for residents
pros: The sisters dedicate their lives to caring for older people. The Little Sisters of the Poor deeply value hospitality, joyfulness, and community. They love to throw parties.
cons: Limited resources. Nursing home and assisted living care is extremely expensive to provide in the U.S., and the government has done little to control costs/provide support for homes serving low-income people. Hard to recruit/retain workers because pay is generally lower. People are there for the community the sisters foster, not for the pay. Less people are becoming Nuns nowadays, and this threatens the unique model of the Little Sisters. In an effort to keep a strong community of sisters at each home, there is little they can do except close some homes.

pros: Very clean and great pay
cons: Old processes needs to work on policy improvement

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Denver, CO
pros: Staff really cares about residents
cons: Company dynamics can be different, a lot of turn over

review_title: Good values for residents not employees
pros: Residents are treated with the upmost treatment. Employees strive to give them good care. Very clean. Each resident has their own room.
cons: Dangerous staffing ratios due to being understaffed. No annual raises. Some resident care beyond pay grade (CNA work while not certified). Inconsistent schedule in order to get full time hours in. Healthcare provided does not cover contraceptives for women's health.

pros: It was such a positive work environment and I loved helping out the residents and the team
cons: At times it was difficult to get time off and my schedule wasn't super flexible. But it was still a really great place to work.

pros: It is a very warm and cozy environment. The sisters really care about their residents. They pray for their staff and care about them as well.
cons: Health insurance isn’t the best.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Chicago, IL
pros: Everyone seems really nice and sweet
cons: There aren’t many Benefits that they told me about

pros: Easy parking. Beautiful and clean facility
cons: The worst place to work. The place is run by nuns who are not educated in management or nursing. They have no life other than the nursing home and they expect you to show the same dedication to your job as you do without any regard to your personal or family life. If you take sick leave they will guilt and bully you even if you are legitimately sick. I would never recommend anyone to work here especially considering the pay is so low.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Kansas City, MO
pros: Very friendly and good work environment
cons: Can’t do your work from home

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Denver, CO
pros: Great first job for CNA
cons: The CNAs are a bit understaffed

pros: Working with Sisters (Nuns) is a wonderful experience that all should do at least once in their career
cons: There are no Cons here.

pros: Home environment is good for the residents.
cons: The management needs to be more compassionate.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Newark, DE
pros: Benefits are good , able to accrue sick time, earn paid days off when work holidays
cons: Communication poor at times, staffing issues

job_title: Nursing Assistant, Assisted Living Floor in Henrico, VA
pros:
Friendly Residents - low maintenance (assisted living)
Work with only one other person- CNA & MedTech 
Take 30-1hr break whenever you want 
Quiet Environment 
Minimum Work
cons:
Drama, Drama, Drama! Staff will talk behind your back like there's no tomorrow! They will be nice to you but will report you to supervisors non-stop. Secondly, there is barely enough workers. We constantly have to fill in at such an inconvenience. It's like you have to get rid of your private life and use all your time to work. Matter of fact, the scheduler had to work multiple times to fill in other shifts. That is beyond unfair and she should not have to be expected to be that generous with her time. Thirdly, poor management! The supervisors are rude and just as bad as the staff. My supervisor was never on the floor; she would come to check on us twice a shift. There was no one to ask for extra help or even to make major decisions. Also, management does not fix the issues you have such as charting. This falls in line with working together, everyone is on their own agenda. There is absolutely no open communication among staff. As you can see, there are many more cons than pros. 

Bottom line: I do not recommend this job to anyone. I strongly advise you to chose another job. 
Also please know my reviews are for the assisted living floor. I wouldn't advise the long term care floor either.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Kansas City, MO
pros: There is very caring leadership, they genuinely want you to succeed.
cons: The scheduling can be unorganized with a lot of last minute changes.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Perth, Western Australia
pros: Staff , environment, residents, sisters
cons: Salary, nil other cons to add

pros: I liked the residents and my team
cons: Management were poor and discriminatory towards young people

pros: I love working for them
cons: I have nothing bad to say.

pros: Its a good company to work for
cons: Very Picky on their selection of workers

pros: Residents are a joy to serve
cons:
Sisters are condescending, disrespectful, rude,  racist.  
Sisters who have no management experience take positions they know nothing about, simply creating more work for everyone else. 
They expect you to give your entire life to them for little pay, no respect  while overlooking  the laws they brake and abuse of the residents. 
Donations are not for the residents, sisters keep the donations for themselves.
Only expect good treatment if you are giving them lots of money as a donor, otherwise don't expect to be acknowledged. 
All in all, everything that is utterly despicable with religion becomes very apparent at this place.

pros: Everyone I work with is very friendly. I love interacting with the residents and making their dining area as tidy and safe as possible.
cons:
I was given very few hours to begin working here. I'm not sure if it's due to my lack of experience in health care or just because some of their employees wanted more time off.

The nuns are also very difficult to deal with sometimes. If you work here, you will have to grit your teeth when being criticized by some of the nuns because they are aging just as much as the residents and tend to not realize how rude they come off sometimes.

pros: Very clean.. organized. The sisters make sure the residents are well taken care of. Decent pay! Nice flow of overtime. Very pleasant environment. Everything from the clean environment to the friendly staff, to the understanding sisters and HR (overall).
cons: I tried working in another nursing home after leaving Little Sisters and I realize there are no real cons at little sister to be honest. You're going to have days where you're short staffed everywhere at least here you won't be overwhelmed.

job_title: Charge Nurse/Supervisor in Warrensville Heights, OH
pros:
Good autonomy 
Caring staff
Good patient to provider relationship

It was a great place to work. I really enjoyed working here, it is a shame that they closed the one on Richmond road though.
cons:
The DON could be very abrasive
It's old school run by the nuns
The PCNAs can be very caddy

Overall it was a good place to work, but you got treated like a child at times and not a professional. The place is run well, but it is very strict there.

pros: The Sisters are caring and friendly. The homes are much cleaner than any other nursing home I've been in. The mission of caring for the elderly poor is admirable.
cons: Many people who should be in exempt positions are not. Even Directors must clock in and out, and HR policies have become more and more aggressive. You earn sick time, but are punished in your review if you use it.

pros:
The residents are respected, cherished, and know that their lives matter and make a positive difference every day (no matter how much care they need).
This is a place full of love, hope, and faith and the sisters lead by example and the staff follow suit. 
EVERYONE who grows old should be so blessed as to reside here.
The nurses are given the time and resources to truly practice nursing.
cons: Payscale is somewhat lower than comparable employers but they are non-profit.

pros: The residents, nice volunteers, some nice co-workers
cons:
Some co-workers with seniority are not very friendly at times in their way of speaking to new staff.

Meetings would be organised for training purposes, but then would be cancelled without notifying some of the attendees. One day I showed up to a training session to be told it had been cancelled, but I hadn't been notified, so I wasted my time  and bus fare going there. 

I was also asked to attend a staff meeting on my day off, and was told that my time during the meeting was unpaid. Unfair.

review_title: New management is not better management
pros: Caring for our elderly residents matters to them, one unit sister in particular is hard but fair
cons: new managers have come in and made this place awful, there is much confusion more than the usual changes that happen, used to be a good place but now we're all looking elsewhere due to the sudden changes and threats

review_title: Jobs to fill a gap, but not long term
pros:
flexible about family needs,
will pray for all you,
take great care of the patients
cons:
uneven management, Sisters rotate every 3-6 years; though they hold the top management positions, they are only trained through online degree programs and what they pick-up from one another, thus, they are quite naive about the running of the business.
As traditional nuns who are semi-cloistered, they know little about collaboration, boundaries, and professionalism. The culture entices some people, but turns off those who expect to be treated as adults. The benefits package is for the employee only and is very low end. 
Minuscule pay raises (1% - 2%) and only every 3 - 4 years

review_title: Slow paced, laid back but residents get the best care
pros: The sisters are committed to their work. The aged are well taken care of and live in a clean safe environment.
cons: Not a place to learn a lot of health care related issues. The company is currently being sold to another company so we are yet to see how that will affect the quality of care given.

pros: The mission to take care of the sick and elderly is wonderful and they do a great job. Very clean and beautiful environment
cons: They treat their residents with the best care while they are disrespectful and manipulating towards the staff. Understaffed is chronic and the blame always gets thrown to the scheduling staff even though they don’t hire fast enough and can’t keep good staff. Very sad.

pros: The residents are a joy to work with. Small community so you are able to know all the sisters and the residents family
cons: They have poor staffing and bad communication. They do not follow there own policies and there is a lax in structure of authority

pros: The residents are well cared for, resident to nurse ratios are great, there is room for some growth in the company. Every one is really sweet and supportive, it's really a nice place to work.
cons: The pay and benefits aren't very good.

The Sisters are just delightful
Great Activity Department

pros: Loving company to work for. The sisters really care about their residents and employees. All the nurses and staff are really friendly
cons: People pass away that you get attached to. Other than that I really don't have anything bad to say about the company.

pros: A nice work environment clean
cons: Pay is low nuns can be a little overbearing most non-nursing

pros: Home Like environment, Focused on Resident care, Good core employee base and seems like family environment.  Good health insurance.

cons: Sometimes a bit too micromanaging, depending of course on the personality of the nun in charge but overall great to work with.

review_title: As with any job, there are pros and cons :)

cons: Salary is not competitive with similar positions in the area, short staffed, heavy case load of patients

pros: The workers are genuinely passionate about helping the elderly and most of the elderly is happy there and appreciates the workers.

pros: Loved the residents, the quality care, and values. Absolutely a wonderful place! Loved working here!
